website_summaries.verdict: Best-selling product and part of the trusted Coleman line of coolers.
pros: Keeps ice from melting for up to 5 days
Drain in the back of the cooler lets you release water without dumping the entire cooler
Lid and walls feature extra insulation
Designed to hold up to 250 lb., so it can double as a chair
cons: Some customers reported problems with the handle falling off

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT cooler! Packed it up for camping Friday morning and it still had about half of the ice was still there when we unpacked it Monday night. When we pulled the eggs out on Saturday morning they were actually frozen and had to thaw a bit before we could cook breakfast....so don't put those right next to a block of ice in this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy B

customer_reviews.title: Performs almost as advertised and pretty awesome for the cost
customer_reviews.text: We used this camping three days and nights on Cape Cod (daytime 75, nights 55) and it kept impressively cold. Opened and closed it a lot and it needed to have ice replenished on the fourth day. Well-built, wheels performed on rough trail to walk-in site, including bumping it up and down some stairs. Only one little issue -- top won't stay open on its own, Coleman should add a folding hinge that locks in place on one side to prop it up. Otherwise, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kayson

customer_reviews.title: this thing is garbage. and amazon pcustomer service did not work with ...
customer_reviews.text: this item broke within 5 minutes of using it. the screws that hold the lid on kept popping out and we couldn't screw it back in after trying multiple times. so the cover does not work right. this thing is garbage. and amazon pcustomer service did not work with me on refund and expected me to be able to ship it back. completely poor item and customer service. do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Katzman

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler but lid does not stay up as you ...
customer_reviews.text: Good cooler but lid does not stay up as you load or unload. I have to use my head to hold the lid up. It kept things cold but not for 5 days - perhaps two before the bags of ice were melting. Handy to get through doors though.
customer_reviews.author: the girls

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to move
customer_reviews.text: Its real nice. Was able to put in a case of beer and 16 cans of soft drinks and still have room for 2 bottles of wine for a surprise party for my son's birthday. The ice lasted almost 5 days but it kept all the drinks very ice cold. The best part is the handle on the side. Made moving the unit a breeze. The cooler was also a "chair" for one of the guys. Good investment without paying hundreds of dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for hubby to replace his old one. He loves it. Bigger than I expected, which is a plus for hubby. Now he has more space for his beers. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Tipuk

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler!
customer_reviews.text: What I needed and was delivered in four days, my old cooler handle broke and hated that the handle was in the middle of the cooler because it never fit through doors. This one has the handle at the end so I don't have that issue, good Coleman cooler!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be warned. Deceptive adveriting.
customer_reviews.text: Our family got in a bind and lost our home refrigerator. I did research and chose the Coleman cooler based on keeping ice for 5 days. The ice melted in less than 24 hours with the cooler sitting inside my house, out of direct sunlight. 24 fours is a far cry from the 5 days Colemen advertises. Beware...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Petclix

customer_reviews.title: Where are the wheels?
customer_reviews.text: What?? Wheels not included?? The freaking thing is missing the wheels The return exchange was not that complicated but wish i didnt had to do all that, guess i was the lucky one lol
customer_reviews.author: Tony r

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The claim of holding ice for 5 days is baloney, at least when you’re actually using it. I pre-chilled the cooler with ice inside an air conditioned room for 24 hours, then filled it with cold drinks from the fridge and topped it off with more ice. Within 24 hours of driving the ice was almost all gone, and I’d only opened the cooler maybe three times to grab a drink. The second time I grabbed the lifting handles one of them broke off. No, I wasn’t abusing it in any way. Overall, I wouldn’t recommend this nor would I buy it again. Over priced and under performing, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: N. Vollrath

customer_reviews.title: More than a cooler
customer_reviews.text: I’m not using this as a cooler. I needed something sturdy I could sit on to work in my flower beds. Crazy? Nope. Handicapped and elderly. I put my tools and weed killer inside while I drag it around the yard. And I can utilize my cane as well. I looked at actual kneelers/benches but this is suiting me far better. I’m not a tiny person nor is my caboose (lol). This suits me well
customer_reviews.author: Babzdragon

customer_reviews.title: Love the wheels and handle, but...
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a big cooler with wheels for a while and purchased this one after reading the reviews. Two big issues with this one are: 1) the lid has that useless plastic strap to keep it from flopping back, but also won't allow the lid to actually stay up so you can load the stupid thing. 2) the hinges are cheap plastic. I expect they won't last more than a dozen or so trips. I should have known better than to buy a Coleman again. And 5 day ice? LOL. More like 1 very cool day's worth.
customer_reviews.author: donhooksc

customer_reviews.title: It works fine and doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: What can you say? Ice chest. It works fine and doesn't leak. Hindsight? May have bought a little larger box, but I'm happy with what I've got.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn’t stay open and very hard to open the lid.  Otherwise its a nice cooler
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is a great size and I loved the carrying handles and the tow handle. I am sending it back because the lid doesn’t stay open while you are trying to put items in and the lid is extremely hard to open. I had to use two hands and brace my foot against the bottom to get it open. You would think it’s a no brainer that a cooler lid should be able to stay open while you are filling the cooler and it should be relatively easy to open. Not sure why Coleman hasn’t included those two vital characteristics in any cooler they manufacture. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget M. Horsley

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: I had a nice cooler but the drain plug got lost and with advancing years carrying the full unit was definitely a 2 person job. This one is a bit of a different configuration...taller and narrower but the handle and wheels are exactly what I need. I am hoping that I can still pack it with as much food for our annual trip to the mountains, but even if it's a bit harder to load, the transporting ease will definitely be worth the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t hold 30lbs of ice for 24 hrs
customer_reviews.text: Finally used this cooler for the 1st time and what a disappointment. Cooler did NOT hold ice for 24hrs! We put 30lbs of ice on already cold drinks from the fridge and it didn’t even last 24 hrs. Major disappointment. We only opened the lid twice to get drinks and ended up using our cheap mini igloo cooler that’s still 2/3rds full of ice even after pulling several drinks out of it. Little cheap $20 WM cooler outperforming this cooler is sad. Guess we will make this our day trip fish cooler and go with an RTIC cooler for weekend trip food and drink storage cooler.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep ice as ice for the 5 days it claims
customer_reviews.text: I admit I was a bit skeptical that it keeps the ice for 5 days. I was in need of this size cooler though so we gave it a shot. We put the ice in on Friday afternoon about 3pm and left the cooler in our air-conditioned kitchen overnight. When we checked in the morning around 9am it had melted to a few inches of water and about 1/2 the ice was left. It is hard to open unless filled which is good and bad. Good for the seal but bad to open empty.
customer_reviews.author: Artzlady

customer_reviews.title: Handle came off
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ahead of time for a big party. The large handle designed for pulling the cooler came off the first and only time we used it. Return window had passed. Annoying.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and very spacious
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take on road trip to Florida and really glad we did. Very spacious and good quality, kept everything very cold. It was so nice to have a cooler on wheels to take from the truck to our condo.... I don't think we could have carried one that heavy as it was packed with all kinds of food and drinks. We will enjoy using for future parties and trips.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Ice completely melts by the next day.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for some camping trips we had in the summer. But I just started using it because we needed the extra “refrigerator” space. The ice melts as easy as if it were left outside. I put a bag of ice and by the next day is just water. At the beginning I thought I was not closing it properly so I made sure it was closed and sealed properly. But the next day, same thing; ice was water and nothing was cold. My return date has passed so I can’t return it. Almost $40 down the drain. :(
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor
customer_reviews.text: Adding wheels are just brilliant idea! While keeping it functions the same as traditional one but with wheels, it adds a lot mobility to it which helps a bunch to move stuff around. Usually we stuff a lot in and it would be extremely hard to carry around. This just works perfectly !
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Waston

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended - leaky and wheels fall off
customer_reviews.text: We started with 30# of ice and a week later still had about 10# left. The problem comes when the wheels come off as you're moving it and when the drain plug comes undone driving down the road - it was in when we loaded it back in the car and when we got to our location it had popped off and leaked everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Sarah A. Crossland

customer_reviews.title: The right cooler for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new cooler for an upcoming beach day and purchased this cooler from this seller, because delivery was promised a day before my event and it has wheels. The cooler arrived on time and in great shape. This cooler is very roomy and the wheels make it easy to move around when it's loaded up w/ food and beverages. Greatly value, if you're in the market for a new cooler. I'd do business w/ this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cold
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for Christmas because his of many years finally needed replacing. Our power went out and I borrowed it. Ice did not melt and actually I was lazy and didn't take all the ice out when power came back on and I put groceries back up. A couple days later when emptied it, very little ice had melted. Good choice. I love my dad so much and wanted to get him a yeti but it just costs too much. I think this is a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooler!
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to spend ten times the cost of this product on a fancy cooler, but this one is amazing! It’s super easy to maneuver, keeps ice five days like it claims and has a drain in the bottom. We camped for five days and it held more than enough for a family of four, including two teenagers. I’m super happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Burns

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: This is a conveniently sized cooler. It kept things cold and we still had some ice in the cooler at the end of 5 days (shaded, 80 degree weather). These are the things we do to keep things cool as long as possible 1) put blue ice in the cooler the night before we load it; 2) when loading we remove the blue ice and put ONLY refrigerated items in the cooler, as well as a gallon jug of water that has been frozen solid; 3) finish off with as much ice as possible.
customer_reviews.author: BlueKarma

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: This thing held ice for two days straight while camping. It kept everything nice and cold! I couldn’t be more pleased. Plus the wheels and handle on it was very convenient (no problems with the handle falling off here either)!! There is a super fancy measuring scale on the top for fishing, and I love the cup holders on the top as well. This was also the perfect size for drinks and food. Paid $44 for it and it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sammon

customer_reviews.title: Best Cooler on the Market
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman is the best cooler on the market. There are a lot of gimmick coolers out there that you can waste your money on that will keep things frozen for weeks at a time. If you really need a cooler to keep ice frozen for that amount of time you should just purchase a freezer. The price of these ridiculous competitors are nearly the cost of a freezer / refrigerator. This is a real cooler at a reasonable cost. I take this thing camping for long weekends and have never had any issues with food or drinks kept in the cooler. This thing has a ton of space inside and wheels what more could you want from a cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Grim

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooler but hinges suck
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is great. The fold up/down handle design is way better than the ones with retractable handles. The only problem is that the hinges suck and the screws keep falling out. I got replacement hinges and longer screws, so hopefully that will fix the problem. Expect to spend another $20 on hinges and screws though.
customer_reviews.author: Sean McNichol

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooler for the Price
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is lightweight and roomy. The wheels come in handy when the cooler is full, much easier on the back. It is advertised to keep frozen up to 5 days at temps up to 90, 3 days is more like it. We were traveling in AC car and brought inside hotel when stopped. The food stayed cold but the ice melted. Drain in bottom is handy and prevents having to pull everything out to drain the water.
customer_reviews.author: Susan has Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Handle Broke - 1st Use
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about getting a new cooler and didn't want to spend stupid money for one. This keeps your things nice and cold after 2 days of camping. I had some reusable ice packs in there and a bag of ice and they were still cold. However, when I got home and lifted it up by one of the handle to dump the water, the handle broke. I asked for an exchange, so hopefully the 2nd one is more durable.
customer_reviews.author: y2says

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cooler!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT cooler!!!!! We went camping for 2 days put a 20lb bag of ice in the cooler with food for the weekend and we still had ice left in the cooler when we got back home. The cooler keep everything cold so cold in fact that our tub of whipped butter was frozen in the morning when we went to make breakfast. I would definitely recommend this cooler to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdily Built with Great Seal
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a cheap cooler to convert into a fishing cooler. First trip, we loaded it with groceries and a couple of gallon jugs of ice. The lid seals so well that the ice did not melt for four days and it was always cool inside to keep my bait and drinks nice and fresh. Handle is solid and the walls are nice and thick, insulated. I am ecstatic about this purchase based on price and performance.
customer_reviews.author: ROB

customer_reviews.title: Lid won't stay open
customer_reviews.text: I ignored the advise from other reviewers about the lid being unable to stay open and the location where we place our fingers to open the lid being too small/tight. Now I just received the cooler and I am trying to open the lid myself. I am kind of regret about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought for camping during covid and needed a cooler that could consistently keep things at ~32 degrees. We froze two 1-gallon water bottles and they kept the cooler cold for 3-4 days at a time (keeping the lid openings to a minimum). After day 3 we would add 1/2 bag of ice into it to keep it cold with openings. 5-6 days later, the water jugs still had partial ice in them and the cooler still at ~35 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Texas

customer_reviews.title: BEST COOLER EVER
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews... this product warrants a review! I bought this for a road trip. I got to 111 degree weather in Palm Springs and unpacked the items. The next day I thought I would empty the water out and I was surprised to see the cooler with all the formed original ice. This cooler kept formed ice for days! REALLY good deal and great product !
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Cooler Review
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use cooler. Glad we checked before buying that it had a water release valve as the cooler doesn’t stay as cold as I’d like. Went on a 4 day camping trip (3 nights) and still had to buy ice everyday to replenish what melted, even when we prepared the cooler before our trip. Still had a decent amount of ice left and was cold, however, but not as full as I’d like.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cooler for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research before buying this cooler. First and most importantly, this cooler kept my food cold for days. I was camping for 4 days and there was ice still unmelted after we got back! Secondly, this cooler is made really well. The top fits super tightly which is one of the reasons things stay cool. Also the multiple handles make it easy to carry and move around. It’s the perfect size. Not too big and not too small. I can’t say enough how great this cooler is and what a value it is. I considered briefly buying a Yeti but am so glad I didn’t have to.
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Sophie Divenyi

customer_reviews.title: True 5 day Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a specific camping trip in Eastern Washington (during upper 90's weather). The trip was for 5 days and I never had to add ice. There was a very minimal amount of water at the end of the 5 days and everything stayed really cold despite sitting in the direct sun most of the trip. We did put a light blanket over the cooler in hopes of keeping ice from melting but it was not heavy enough to make much difference. Very impressed with the this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good and durable, but kinda hard to use the wheels
customer_reviews.text: It's probably an older model of Coleman's insulated water coolers, but it still works great. I made a mistake trying to move it, and the wheel had got stuck somehow and I spilled some half-melted ice everywhere. I later saw that the wheel was just hanging, it at cracked somehow, but them's the breaks with buying used with cosmetic issues. I don't move it anyway, I keep it in my room to keep cold stuff close by, so maneuverability wasn't an issue in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Crowl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay cold
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are a nice feature. Did NOT remotely live up to the promises on keeping things cold. Experienced a significant amount of ice melt in the first 24 hours camping in the Pacific Northwest (it wasn't hot). Nice if you want to keep drinks cool for a party or keep stuff cold for a picnic, but you need to replace ice every other day.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS AROUND STOPPER
customer_reviews.text: This leaks profusely around the outside of the drain. Not sure if I just got a reject or if this is a common problem.
customer_reviews.author: shopperadvice

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time using this cooler since buying it in March and I’m pretty disappointed. We were up at the lake for less than 24 hours and pretty much all the ice had melted. I’ve had put more ice in it twice and it has been less than 2 days. It advertises that it keep ice for up to 5 days in 90 degree weather and for some reason mine couldn’t hold ice for 24 hours in 70 degree weather. Pretty disappointed. I read the reviews and thought this will be awesome but this sucks.
customer_reviews.author: SagesMom707

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but won't keep ice for five days.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade from a cheaper cooler I had. The wheels are a nice touch, as it can get quite heavy when full. I am not sure if it can truly keep ice for five days - when we went camping, our ice was mostly melted after day two (granted, it was hot out). Overall though, it was a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a team outing and thank God I got the wheels as I had to lug the full cooler a few blocks to the park where we were meeting. Way cheaper than the other brands and perfectly functional. It's the next night and I'm still grabbing seltzers, beers out of it. Still ice.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Crowder

customer_reviews.title: Raccoon proof!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is awesome, keeps ice for days even in direct sun. We took this on our honeymoon camping trip and the raccoons have learned how to unzip tents and screened in canopies. This cooler kept all of our food safe because they couldn't lift the lid. Amazing product! Buying another one soon!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: The Lid Doesn't Stay Open.
customer_reviews.text: Who the heck designs a cooler where the lid doesn't stay open on its own? Couldn't the design have incorporated some type of stay open hinges or else a thin rod (as with a car hood?) to help keep the lid propped up and open? GAH. I am assigning this Coleman 62-Quart cooler a grade 'F' for WTF.
customer_reviews.author: @your6Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good product but poor lid design
customer_reviews.text: Good cooler. Gave it overall 3 stars for the poor lid design, it does not stay up. So you have to hold it open with one hand and load with other hand. Also, you have to push the lid closed or else it stays ajar hence ice melts faster.
customer_reviews.author: True Blue

customer_reviews.title: Good camping cooler
customer_reviews.text: Love the handles and drain spout. I’ve never thought cupholders on top of a cooler made sense since you have to remove the drinks to get inside, but they’re deep enough to hold a lighter, pack of cards, etc while the lid is open without tumbling out. ~20 percent of our ice was still ice after a day.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep the ice 5 days as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We thought we were saving money and getting a cooler comparable to a Yeti. You get what you pay for!. We love the size and it is easy to move with the wheels and handle but it only keeps ice for 24 hours or so and that is not out in the hot weather. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every panny, we went camping 3 times with this cooler box and it keeps everything cold for the 48 hours we were out (ofcourse you need ice!) You dont need a massive amount of ice to keep it cold and we kept on adding drinks and beer to the cooler and it actually cooled them. If you are on a budget and you need a good cooler, this is what you are looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Kalman Goodman

customer_reviews.title: COOLER - NOT SO COOL
customer_reviews.text: Although the cooler worked as needed - This cooler did not keep ice for 5 days - 3/4 day at best. Not sure how they consider this to keep ice for as long as they stated. I would keep moving on unless you just need a cooler for a day.
customer_reviews.author: Conservative Right Winger

customer_reviews.title: Good performance
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this cooler. It kept the ice for 3 days and is easy to use with the wheels and handle even when heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B

customer_reviews.title: Holds ice really well especially when I add extra measures.
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was quick. I love this cooler. I had an older version, that was pretty beat up. This version is lighter in weight. It holds ice really well, especially when I do other things to keep it cold. It’s very easy to transport. Time will tell how the tires hold up, though. One of the reasons I needed a new one is because the tires came off.
customer_reviews.author: Cristi B

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my parents cooler that I broke. This thing is HUGE! It is super easy to move around with the wheels or carrying it. We’ve been on vacation for 2 days and I’ve had to refill it with ice once so far. So it definitely doesn’t do that, but for the price you can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Still had ice after 9 hours in Texas sun
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my crews, they work outside all day in Texas and its HOT. Their old coolers didn't stay cold and their drinks never were either. They were really happy to say that at the end of the day, they still had ice in their coolers. Its pretty big too so they can fit their drinks and lunches inside easily. Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Needs some refinement
customer_reviews.text: I shouldn't be too hard on this product. We use them as packing cases for traveling on the airlines. On the first trip the AL handlers knocked the handle off and on the second trip they knocked the wheels off. That's OK because I patch them up and away we go again.
customer_reviews.author: tonyk

customer_reviews.title: Great size for the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for an anticipated hurricane in South Florida. While the hurricane greatfully turned and didn't hit us, we kept the food in the Coleman to see if it worked well. Kept all our food cold for a few days and was easy to empty. A Great buy for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep things cool that long
customer_reviews.text: Con: I put frozen vacuum packed chicken in this cooler with six large frozen gel packs. By 15 hrs, the chicken (and the gel packs) was completely thawed, by 20 hrs they were starting to get room temp. If would only use it for a day trip. Pro: You can fit a lot in the cooler. Neutral: It's hard to prop the lid open. Which is a little annoying when your trying to fill it. But it's also helpful, to make sure it's never accidentally left open.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: First use has been very pleasant. It rolls easily. Handle is right length and sturdy (I'm 5'7" and over 65 years old and sedentary). After 24 hours the fozen beverages are still partially frozen. I'm happy with it so far. If that changes I'll update my review.😉
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was described and ordered
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a present. This is exactly what was described and the perfect sized cooler. If it is anything like the cooler we have, they will love it. It was also shipped in a sturdy box and well protected. Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Chest
customer_reviews.text: This chest is huge! The first time we used it we took it on a week long camp trip. It kept everything cold the whole week with just the initial ice we put in it. The lid seals really tight which makes it a little difficult to open, but that is also what makes it keep ice so well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is exactly what I was looking for. My last one pulled the cooler wide side. This is much better especially when going through doors. It also keeps things cool for a long time. The top seals kind of hard, but I'm sure it contributes to the longer lasting ice! Glad I bought it and would buy another one if I lost it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven DesLauriers

customer_reviews.title: Far From Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cooler but other reviews that are critical of the lid not staying up and the handle presenting problems were exactly correct. The lid constantly falling back down is very aggravating and I could not come up with a good solution. Ice keeps about 3 days. The lid makes a good seal despite not having a latch. The side handles are the best feature when it comes to lifting the cooler. It was the best cooler of all the ones I looked at in the stores, but it is far from perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler
customer_reviews.text: Have used this on 2 camping trips, leaving it in the truck (bear country) with the windows open during the day on 90 degree days. Froze 4 large plastic containers of water ( about 8x8x3") and it kept things very nicely cold for our 3 night trips. Still had ice when we got home.
customer_reviews.author: bobeau

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: This cooler kept temperature for 3 days . I sandwich 1 block of dry ice and a bag of ice between 2 sheets of Styrofoam, at the 4th day when we came home the ice was still frozen and no one drop of water.
customer_reviews.author: mimi

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Just took this on a 4 day camping trip with 90+ degree heat each day and the coolers being locked in the bear metal bear proof cages the whole time. Had to refill the ice once, but my other 2 coolers were completely melted and had to replace the water a couple times. Definitely can tell the difference. Handle and wheels were a plus also.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler for the price. The wheel helps make transport easy. The cooler is big enough to bring a lot of groceries on long drives. The only thing I would say that they could improve on is the outlet to drain the water.
customer_reviews.author: Impulsive Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooler!! The wheels and handle make it so easy to move around and the size is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Jones

customer_reviews.title: Coleman is always the best buy.
customer_reviews.text: Coleman is always the best buy. Very Satisfied. High recommend this procuct
customer_reviews.author: Alvie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Small handle broke off upon picking it up
customer_reviews.text: When I picked up the cooler out of my car (there wasn't much inside - maybe 15#), one of the small handles broke off. (I could only find one of the connection pieces so I don't think there was ever two to hold it together) . I haven't even used it for its intended purpose yet and it's too big to return. It can still be used as the large extended handle can be used, but still annoying. I need a replacement handle so will reach out to sellers to see if they will send one.
customer_reviews.author: SPChicago

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for the beach
customer_reviews.text: I got this cooler to take to the beach for sunbathing and/or fishing keeps the ice for 3 days easily and easy to get through the sand to the shore. I would get another if I needed one or recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Norton

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-size cooler
customer_reviews.text: Good size for a weekend’s food for 2 people, fits in the backseat of a small car, and is easy to maneuver because of the wheels and the pull-handle. Very sturdy, yet not heavy in weight. Great cooler!
customer_reviews.author: JA's reviews

customer_reviews.title: Handy cooler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler for our granddaughter. She kept borrowing ours. Now she has her own! She likes the size of cooler and the handle for carrying . Hopefully she will get a lot of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: deedee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cooler for the beach.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 50 quart Coleman cooler. It is great for our beach trips. It holds enough perishables that last 5-7 days. It is sturdy & easy to maneuver. I highly recommend this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fishing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler. It's 62 quart and I use it for walleye fishing. Seems very sturdy and rolled easily. It kept the walleye ice cold on a day near 90 and they were still frozen the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzy

customer_reviews.title: Still had ice after 5 days
customer_reviews.text: This really works. I still had ice in the cooler after 5 days on a very hot camping trip. The price is so much more reasonable than other more pricey brands. I highly recommend tjis.
customer_reviews.author: Zanniegsp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooler. This stays pretty cold for a couple days if you buy a lot of ice and don't open it very often. The roller is very useful and the handles make for easy grabbing. The plug to drain it is great!!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Hamlet

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE NEW MODEL - the new lid is extremely difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE NEW MODEL - the new lid is extremely difficult to open as there's hardly any room to fit your fingers (unlike original model). The drain spout is very awkward to reach, as it's lower not easy to find. You can't even see it, making it difficult to use. I've had many of these in the past and loved them. Can't imagine how the remodel was approved.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Pedrini

customer_reviews.title: If you have the space to keep it this is a great find.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot answer about all the questions but It’s big and when you have no power for days like in New York now this is a great deal. I ordered two one to share
customer_reviews.author: Jessy M.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Kept 10 lbs ice for 5 days and had some left. Granted, it was only 70ish degrees, but much of the time the lid wasnt closed all the way, put warm food in, and still kept great. Excellent value for money. Wish they made them in white or light colors.
customer_reviews.author: udontknowme

customer_reviews.title: Ice good for less than one day
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy cooler with decent wheels. As far as the “keeps things cold for 5 days” claim, ice melts in less than a day in mid 80 degree temps, so I’m not sure how the cooler will continue to cool contents for another 4 days without ice?
customer_reviews.author: J. C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all. Went for an overnight camping trip and icy was melted (we were keeping the lid shut, barely opened it), handle keeps falling off, and the lid doesn’t stay open. Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Molly S

customer_reviews.title: Why buy a Yeti?
customer_reviews.text: Why buy a yeti? This cooler kept my ice from melting for 3 days! I kid you not I had this cooler in my house for a series of parties for a long weekend and put in a 20# bag of ice, I maybe drained a quart of ice after 3 days. 10/10 would recommend. 1/10th of the price of a yeti cooler
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good ice last about 4 days after it’s primed
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Chest
customer_reviews.text: We've used a lot of ice chests in our time -- this is the best so far. It is huge, keeps ice for days, and so easy to pull. Seems very heavy duty - I think it's going to last. We have used it for camping as well as other travels. We are very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LittleRedHen

customer_reviews.title: Very cool Cooler...
customer_reviews.text: The cooler surprisingly lived up to the claim that it will keep the ice still after several days in ~90 degree weather. Also it extremely well made and easy to move around with it's wheels or two slid up sturdy handles.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Like the cooler
customer_reviews.text: Like the cooler, and is a good price. Wheels and handles work well and so does the plug. It however is not a 5 day cooler. Kept inside a cabin for a few days. After day 2 ice was melted. Two day cooler at most depending on the weather conditions. Lid doesn’t fully fold or come off. Not a big deal for me but FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Kept ice for three days when summer camping. Recommend covering cooler with wet towel to keep ice longer. Drain plug is hard to get to, but OK
customer_reviews.author: slburnham58

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Took this with me tent camping, held ice for about 4 days without any issues. That's with me opening and closing alot to get beers and food to cook 2 meals too.
customer_reviews.author: kristin

customer_reviews.title: great cooler
customer_reviews.text: this is a fantastic deal for the money. it wont stop a bear, but for normal people, this is a great option. stuff stays cold and the wheels make it very easy to move around. will definitely have this cooler for many years. priced very well
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M

customer_reviews.title: Great insulation
customer_reviews.text: This works fantastically. This is our backup fridge for larger parties so we can store all the alcohol. One 10lb bag of ice will last 2 days inside.
customer_reviews.author: Chad D

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler So Far
customer_reviews.text: This cooler arrived in 2 days. We've only used it once, but it worked great. Had ice in it for 3 days and there was still a lot of ice when we poured it out. It holds a lot and it's pretty easy to pull.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a beach trip. Needed something to keep steaks, beer, and ice cream cold. It did the job very well. Easy to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Blackstar5

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago but finally used it. I didn’t want to spend the money for a fancier brand, and I chose well! The ice lasts for days! This one is quite large but I LOVE the room!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Ewert

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler and keep items cold
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect cooler for traveling around with. I like the handle and wheels which makes it easier to handle.
customer_reviews.author: mmightymite

customer_reviews.title: it’s damaged
customer_reviews.text: it seems great, but it just came and has this giant dent on the top. no damage to the packaging so i’m assuming it was sent like this. i don’t love that it’s brand new and damaged!
customer_reviews.author: mikell

customer_reviews.title: Will never carry a large cooler again!
customer_reviews.text: Having wheels and a long handle on a large cooler is the way to go. Pack it full and never worry about the weight or distance to the destination.
customer_reviews.author: C Kehoe

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I needed when moving
customer_reviews.text: I am moving - closing one day and moving in the next. I needed a large cooler with a drain and that was moveable. This cooler did the trick and was AWESOME! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with this cooler
customer_reviews.text: The size and price is right but the ice melts before 3 days are up. We are experiencing a long term heat wave in (we are in a mid Atlantic state) of temperatures in the 90's + and high humidity. Wish I had searched for a better cooler despite the many high ratings of this one. I read that Coleman is USA made which I prefer. Any recommendations?
customer_reviews.author: K.V.

product_meta.title: Coleman 62-Quart Xtreme 5-Day Heavy-Duty Cooler with Wheels, Blue/White
product_meta.description: Keep your food and drinks cold for an extended time, and make the fun last longer, when you roll in with a Coleman 62 quart XTREME 5 wheeled cooler. Extreme technology uses an insulated lid and extra insulation in the walls to keep your items cold for up to 5 days. Large enough to hold 95 cans, you'll have plenty of space for refreshments for a whole group of people. Whether you're headed on a long weekend camping trip, a road trip, or across the ball field, the heavy-duty wheels and large tow handle let you roll over almost any terrain with hardly any effort. The additional 2-way handles make it easy to lift your cooler in and out of the car or onto a picnic bench. Once you arrive, the Have-A-Seat lid will ensure you always have a place to sit and relax, and the cup holders molded into the lid will keep your cold drink close while you enjoy the day. When the fun is done, the leak-resistant drain makes it easy to empty any excess water, so you're ready for your next fun adventure. Lid supports up to 250 lbs. for a place to sit and rest
feature_bullets: Keeps the ice 5 day ice retention at temperatures up to 90 degree
Leak resistant drain lets you remove water without turning the cooler upside down
Low Co2 insulation for reduced carbon emissions from foam manufacturing
Extreme technology uses an insulated lid and extra insulation in the walls for longer ice retention
Holds 95 cans; Made in the USA
